Name: American Folk Art Museum
Brief Description: Museum featuring over 4,000 pieces of American folk art spanning three centuries. For the price of admission, contact the museum.
Hours of Operation: Tue - Thu: 10:30 AM - 5:30 PM; Fri: 10:30 AM - 7:30 PM; Sat: 10:30 AM - 5:30 PM

Name: American Museum of Natural History
Brief Description: Scientific research and education Museum, housing over 40 exhibition halls, the Rose Center for Earth and Space, and an IMAX theater. Features include special exhibitions, guided tours, and educational programs for children and families. For the price of admission, contact the museum.
Full Address: 175 Central Park West, NEW YORK, NY, 10024
Hours of Operation: Mon - Sun: 10:00 AM - 5:45 PM

Name: American Museum of the Moving Image
Brief Description: Museum dedicated to film, television, and digital media. Special programs include exhibitions, film screenings, lectures, seminars, and tours. For the price of admission, contact the museum.
Hours of Operation: Wed, Thu: 12:00 PM - 5:00 PM; Fri: 12:00 PM - 8:00 PM; Sat, Sun: 11:00 AM - 6:00 PM

Name: Bronx County Historical Society
Brief Description: Promotes knowledge, interest, and research in the Bronx by publishing books and conducting tours, courses, and programs. For the price of admission, contact the museum.
Hours of Operation: Mon - Fri: 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM

Name: Bronx Museum of the Arts
Brief Description: Museum dedicated to twentieth century and contemporary art. Special events include performances and educational programs for adults, teens, and families, as well as gallery tours. For the price of admission, contact the museum.
Hours of Operation: Wed: 12:00 PM - 9:00 PM; Thu - Sun: 12:00 PM - 6:00 PM

Name: Brooklyn Children's Museum
Brief Description: Museum featuring hands-on activities and educational exhibits for children about world cultures, the arts, science and the environment. For the price of admission, contact the museum.

Name: Brooklyn Museum
Brief Description: Second largest Museum in the City, featuring a permanent collection of more than 1.5 million objects representing almost every culture. Public programs include performances, films, gallery talks and tours, and special programs for children and families.  For the price of admission, contact the museum.
Hours of Operation: Wed - Fri: 10:00 AM - 5:00 PM; Sat, Sun: 11:00 AM - 6:00 PM

Name: Childrens Museum of Manhattan
Brief Description: Interactive children's Museum. For the price of admission, contact the museum.

Name: Cooper Hewitt National Design Museum
Brief Description: Museum devoted exclusively to historic and contemporary design. Tours are available. For the price of admission, contact the museum.

Name: Dahesh Museum of Art
Brief Description: Museum devoted to collecting, exhibiting, and interpreting works by Europe's academically trained artists of the 19th and early 20th centuries. For the price of admission, contact the museum.

Name: El Museo del Barrio
Brief Description: Museum dedicated to collecting, preserving, and exhibiting the artistic heritage of Latin Americans in the United States. Public programs include music, dance, film, and educational programs for people of all ages.  For the price of admission, contact the museum.

Brief Description: Organization dedicated to restoring the historic Eldridge Street Synagogue as a center for Jewish heritage. Tours are available.  For the price of admission, contact the museum.

Name: Fire Department Museum and Learning Center
Brief Description: The Museum is opened to the general public and also offers walk-through tours for schoolchildren, day camps and youth and senior groups. The Museum is open to tour groups by appointment only.For the price of admission, contact the museum.

Name: Flushing Town Hall
Brief Description: Arts center and home of the Flushing Council on Culture and the Arts, located in an 1862 Romanesque Revival building. Public programs include art exhibitions, concerts, tours, and educational programs. For the price of admission, contact the museum.

Name: Fraunces Tavern Museum
Brief Description: Museum featuring a collection of objects related to early American and New York City history. Tours are available. For the price of admission, contact the museum.

Name: Frick Collection
Brief Description: Mansion housing sixteen galleries of paintings, sculpture, and decorative arts from the Renaissance through the 19th century. For the price of admission, contact the museum.

Name: Hamilton Grange National Memorial
Brief Description: Federal-style home of the first United States Secretary of the Treasury, Alexander Hamilton. Now a National Parks Service site. For the price of admission, contact the museum.

Name: Historic Richmond Town
Brief Description: Living history village and Museum complex. Visitors can explore the diversity of the American experience, especially that of Staten Island and its neighboring communities, from the colonial period to the present.  For the price of admission, contact the museum.

Name: New York Historical Society

Admission is $10 for adults, $5 for students, seniors and teachers, and free for children under 13 with adult.

Hours of Operation: Tue - Fri: 10:00 AM - 5:00 PM

Name: New York Transit Museum
Brief Description: Museum documenting the technology and social history of mass transportaion. Within a 1936 decommissioned subway station, exhibits include a rotating selection of actual elevated and subway cars.
Full Address: Boerum Pl & Schermerhorn St, Brooklyn, NY 11201
Hours of Operation: Tue - Fri: 10 AM - 4 PM; Sat - Sun: 11 AM – 5 PM
Fee: Adults: $10; Children (2-17): $5; Seniors 62+: $5; Seniors are free on Wednesdays (excludes senior group visits); Museum Members: free

Name: South Street Seaport Museum

The 1885 Pioneer offers daily two-hour public voyages from April through September. For the price of admission, contact the museum.

Name: St. Pauls Chapel
Brief Description: Church built in 1766. Host to many special events and the exhibit Unwavering Spirit: Hope and Healing at Ground Zero.""
Hours of Operation: Mon - Sat: 10:00 AM - 6:00 PM; Sun: 10:00 AM - 4:00 PM

Name: Staten Island Childrens Museum
Brief Description: Museum featuring educational exhibits and hands-on activities for children in Staten Island. For the price of admission, contact the museum.

Name: The Morgan Library and Museum
